H0.text: Fission is the type of reaction that produces two smaller isotopes, more neutrons, and heat energy.

H1.text: Reaction is the type of reaction that produces two smaller isotopes, more neutrons, and heat energy.

H2.text: Diffusion is the type of reaction that produces two smaller isotopes, more neutrons, and heat energy.

H3.text: Fusion is the type of reaction that produces two smaller isotopes, more neutrons, and heat energy.

A4.text: Fission is a form of nuclear transmutation because the resulting fragments (or daughter atoms) are not the same element as the original parent atom.

A5.text: Since in nuclear fission, the nucleus emits more neutrons than the one it absorbs, a chain reaction is possible.
